programme.title: My Great Winter Olympic Moments with Arianna Fontana
programme.desc: Arianna Fontana is the greatest female short track speed skater in Olympic history. Her numbers at the Games speak for themselves; one gold, two silver, and five bronze. In this edition of My Great Winter Olympic Moments she talks about her Tokyo 2020 plans, burnout on ice and life beyond the speed skating ring, with special appearances by her husband and coach Anthony Lobello Jr., Italian Alps, church bells and her beloved Great Dane - Zeus.

programme.title: Team Event, Day 3 - Figure Skating | PyeongChang 2018 Replays
programme.desc: The event - featuring men's free skating, women's free skating and free dance - was held at the Gangneung Ice Arena on 12 February 2018.

programme.title: Competition Season Officially Begins | On Edge
programme.desc: It’s 4 months until Beijing 2022. Four of the teams arrive to Helsinki, Finland, for their first big competition of the season. Olivia and Adrian come face to face with the other Spanish team fighting for the same Olympic spot. Guillaume talks about his coming out story. Madison and Evan are eager to try their brand-new program. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: Martina Sablikova at age 19
programme.desc: With five Olympic medals to her name, including three golds, Martina Sáblíková is the Czech Republic’s greatest-ever speed skater.

programme.title: Gala Exhibition - Figure Skating | PyeongChang 2018 Replays
programme.desc: To celebrate the end of the competition, the best skaters performed free of any constraints at the Gangneung Ice Arena on 25 February 2018.

programme.title: My Great Winter Olympic Moments with Arianna Fontana
programme.desc: Arianna Fontana is the greatest female short track speed skater in Olympic history. Her numbers at the Games speak for themselves; one gold, two silver, and five bronze. In this edition of My Great Winter Olympic Moments she talks about her Tokyo 2020 plans, burnout on ice and life beyond the speed skating ring, with special appearances by her husband and coach Anthony Lobello Jr., Italian Alps, church bells and her beloved Great Dane - Zeus.

programme.title: The first Mexican Olympic figure skater in 30 years | Winter Tracks
programme.desc: When he competes in next Olympic Winter Games, Donovan Carrillo will be the first figure skater from Mexico to do so in 30 years. In a country with barely any Olympic size rinks, he is an artist who believes figure skating has given him the perfect platform to express himself. He moved away from his hometown and family when he was 13. Living with his coach, Gregorio Núñez, a father-like figure, to further his training. Together, they have overcome huge obstacles including lack of resources, funding and recent COVID restrictions to finally qualify for the Games.

programme.title: Salt Lake City 2002: How the ‘fastest ice on earth’ fosters homegrown talent
programme.desc: Derek Parra’s stunning Salt Lake City gold stirred a passion in Jerica Tandiman that sees her chasing glory at PyeongChang 2018.

programme.title: Meet South America’s fastest 17-year-old on roller speed skates
programme.desc: Juan Pablo Arango was national champion at the age of 7. He now looks forward to representing his country on highest levels in his sport.

programme.title: Meet Hungarian short track brothers with high hopes for PyeongChang
programme.desc: The Liu brother have been skating since they were 8 and 11. Will they make their shared dream a reality and medal in PyeongChang 2018?

programme.title: Men's Short Program - Figure Skating | PyeongChang 2018 Replays
programme.desc: The men's short program was held at the Gangneung Ice Arena on 16 February 2018.

programme.title: You & Kierkegaard focused on living their Olympic dream
programme.desc: South Korean figure skater You Young, 11, and teenage Argentine equestrian rider Ricardo Kierkegaard have their sights set on the Olympics.

programme.title: Germany’s Katarina Witt (extended)
programme.desc: Witt was a captivating and skilful figure skating champion. Now, the German legend is working to help those with physical disabilities

programme.title: Pairs Free Skating Final - Figure Skating | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 19/02/2022 at the Capital Indoor Stadium. Wenjing Sui and Cong Han (CHN) claimed the Gold, Evgenia Tarasova and Vladimir Morozov (ROC) Silver and Anastasia Mishina and Aleksandr Galliamov (ROC) completed the podium.

programme.title: Pairs Short Program Final - Figure Skating | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 18/02/2022 at the Capital Indoor Stadium. Wenjing Sui (CHN) and Cong Han (CHN) qualified for the finals with the best score in the Pairs Short Program.

programme.title: Men's Short Program Final - Figure Skating | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 08/02/2022 at the Capital Indoor Stadium Nathan Chen (USA) made the best score with 113.97 Yuma Kagiyama (JPN) 108.12 Shoma Uno (JPN) 105.90
